txt.en: 'Let it not be said that Hildith wife of Grimbold does not honour guests in her hall! Be seated, [placeholder]. I wish to take your counsel.\n\n'It is too long since we have had news from the plains.'
Dunward is outside of the Mead Hall in Grimslade.\n\nYou should speak with Dunward.
Speak with Dunward outside the Mead Hall

You offer your sympathy to Dunward, and tell him that his sage advice did not deserve such a harsh reaction.

'Thank you for saying so, [placeholder]. Grimbold appointed me counsellor in his absence to help Hildith, but she will not have a word from me!

'She is a cold woman. Grimbold is sorely missed; he is loved by all.'
Hildith has opened her doors to you at last and summoned you to sit in on a council meeting.
Hildith is in the Mead Hall of Grimslade.\n\nYou should speak with Hildith.
